attributes.action: consider this green carry-a-bag scheme, to help the planet, and deem it worthy of public endorsement by the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Carry-a-bag scheme to help the planet. If shoppers kept, carried and re-used for a year plastic bags they most recently acquired then landfill sites in the UK would be ‘deprived’ of more than 5,000 million bags a year in my guesstimation.
Within our population of 58.9 million people probably 35.4 million shop every week.  
If each shopper receives an average of three bags a week for, say, 50 weeks that’s 5,310 million bags per year.
Those of us who re-use bags find that shops and their staff are very agreeable to this idea in practice: it really does work.
Supermarkets will have been informed of the idea/scheme and perhaps will consider installing, encouragingly, more “brought your own carry-a-bags” check-outs than conventional ones.
Bag manufacturers would lose business initially.  Less obviously there are subtle eco-friendly ways of advertising etc. that could centre on such a re-using idea.
All things considered this scheme is commended to the Prime Minister Gordon Brown and to the nation.
